newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia's Triangle to merges with NZ's McAlpine.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia's Triangle to merges with NZ's McAlpine.

text.p: Sydney-based commercial refrigeration and air-conditioning firm Triangle Refrigeration Australia said on Thursday it will merge with NZ's McAlpine Refrigeration Ltd.
With a turnover in excess of A$100 million and staff of about 450 the merged company will be one of the largest fully integrated commercial refrigeration companies in Australasia, Triangle said.
Triangle managing director Kevin Stainer said the merger provided each company with significant mutual benefits.
Triangle, which describes itself as the largest national refrigeration contracting company in Australia, has branches in six Australian cities as well as offices in China and Dubai.
However Stainer said it lacked a manufacturing base and saw an advantage in securing an interest in a major product supply line.
McAlpine Refrigeration, based in Auckland, is a leading player in the New Zealand commercial refrigeration and air-conditioning industry, the Triangle statement said.
McAlpine owns a custom-made cabinet manufacturing operation in Tauranga as well as an exclusive Australiasian distribution licence for Hussman Inc of the USA.
For McAlpine the merger fulfils a strategy to become a significant player in Australia and for Triangle it fulfils a strategy to secure a reputable refrigerated cabinet supply one line, Stainer said.
The company formed to control the group will be called McAlpine Triangle Australiasia Pty Ltd.
The new board will have equal representation from both companies.
